text.section: The Authority may guarantee a surety up to the lesser of 90% or $1,350,000 of its loss under a bid bond, payment bond, or performance bond on a contract financed by the federal government, a state government, a local government, a private entity, or a utility that the Public Service Commission regulates.

The term of a guaranty under this part may not exceed the contract term, including:
the maintenance or warranty period required by the contract; and
the period during which the surety may be liable for latent defects.

The Authority may vary the terms and conditions of a guaranty based on:
the Authority's history of experience with a surety; and
any other factor the Authority considers relevant.
